group_1.textLeft: Well, we're off then!
…Hello?

group_1.textRight: Ah! Um…er… You guys are the new @Mikazuki Villa girls…right?
So…I heard it was your first day of school…
Did Yachiyo mention me to you? @She helps me out with my vegetable garden…

group_1.textLeft: Ah! Let’s see…You’re…Kaede?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, that’s right!
Um… I’ll walk to school with you, if you’d like?

group_1.narration: Yachiyo told me that Kaede can@no longer grow vegetables at her house @since an apartment building was built next door.
Currently, she rents a garden plot at Mikazuki Villa.
The reason we’d never met before@is because she waters the plants early@in the morning and never enters the main building.
But today, she heard that this@was our first day of school, @so she waited by the front door.

group_1.textRight: …But, we need to get going soon @or we’ll be late!
Let’s walk and talk!
So, I heard your mom and dad are currently@working abroad?

group_1.textLeft: Uh huh! But I don’t miss them too much@because I have my big sister!

group_1.textRight: I see, you two must be pretty close!

group_1.textLeft: But you see, none of the girls at Mikazuki Villa@go to our school.
So, I’m really glad I got to meet you like this!

group_1.textRight: *Giggle* So I’m your first friend at school.
That makes me really happy!

group_1.textLeft: Now, Miss Tamaki, please introduce yourself@to the class.

group_1.textRight: Ah, I’m Iroha Tamaki! I’m looking forward@to working with you all!

group_1.textLeft: Good, now then… Please take a seat next@to Miss Minami.

group_1.textRight: N-nice to meet you…?
(Oh, um… Did she not hear me?)

group_1.textCenter: For today’s class we’ll be working on@our assigned reading.
Spend this time thinking about the themes @and decide which you’d like to focus on.
Miss Tamaki, did you read the book you @were given in advance?

group_1.textRight: Uh, ah, yes! I’m good!

group_1.textLeft: Okay then, please discuss the material @with the person beside you.

group_1.textRight: (I don’t know… Should I say something first?)
Uh, um… You're Miss Minami, right? @So about our assigned book…
It’s "Night on the Galactic Railroad." @Did you read it?

group_1.textLeft: …[wait:0.8][chara:100901:motion_200][chara:100901:lipSynch_1]Well, it WAS homework, so…

group_1.textRight: Y-yeah! You’re right… @What theme should we choose?

group_1.textLeft: …I’m fine with whatever you pick.
…It’s easier that way.

group_1.textRight: Well…um…what do I do…
Oh! There was this one line that struck @a chord with me.

group_1.textLeft: …Which one?

group_1.textRight: Um… Uh, this one.

group_1.narration: "But I wonder what true happiness really is?"

group_1.textLeft: …That’s pretty much at the end of the book.

group_1.textRight: The phrase "true happiness" is repeated @several times…
It made me think about what it meant to me.
What about you?

group_1.textLeft: …True happiness? I’m not completely sure @what you mean.

I don’t care about anything in particular…@[chara:100901:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:100901:motion_0][chara:100901:cheek_0][chara:100901:face_mtn_ex_030.exp.json][chara:100901:lipSynch_1]It's fine as long as I can watch my favs.

group_1.textRight: Your…favs?

group_1.textLeft: Huh? Don’t you know what a "fav" is?

group_1.textRight: I don’t know much about the latest trends… @Ah ha ha.

group_1.textLeft: …You sound like my grandma…
…It has a few meanings, but it’s like someone @you really love and care about.

group_1.textRight: Someone you’re in love with?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, no! What?! Not like, romantically!
I mean, you know… @Like how you support idols…

group_1.textRight: I see, so you really like idols!

group_1.textLeft: I-it doesn’t matter what I like!

group_1.textRight: It’s okay, having passions is a wonderful thing.

group_1.textLeft: W-well what do you like then?!
Your "true happiness"... @What is it?

group_1.textRight: The most wonderful thing… @Something that makes me truly happy…

group_1.textCenter: The girl would be happy and satisfied…
So there isn’t really a reason to save the world afterwards…

group_1.textRight: (Is true happiness something that everyone @can find for themselves?)
Um…I...guess I don’t really know.
I don’t think I’m unhappy. @Good things happen to me everyday…
But nothing comes to mind when I think of @what makes me truly happy.

group_1.textLeft: …Makes sense. "True happiness" is a pretty @difficult subject.
I doubt that we’ll find an obvious answer.

group_1.textRight: Yeah… You’re right.
Let’s go back to the book and think about it @some more.
